lines.text: You're doing real good, Mrs. Mallory, doing real good. You couldn't be doing no better if you were in one of them fine bedrooms with a brace of nurses and one of them fifty dollar a day doctor.
[she pants and groans]
Mrs. Mallory, I've got to look now.
Look?
See if that baby don't come out straight, and head-first we could have a serious problem. It's going to be alright, but I do have to look.
Do you mean... LOOK?
Yes ma'am. You gotta help me. You got to turn over.
Would you put out your cigar first, please?
[he does]
Now then, you got to turn over on your back and help me... not too fast. Onto your back. Spread your legs just as far as you can.
I am never... going to be embarassed... AGAIN!
Anything else?
Yes. Don't slap the baby.
Ok... why would I slap the baby?
I don't know, but most doctors do. It's a custom I'm not in favor of. Nobody comes into this world looking for a fight. You go get em'!
But, what do you do?
I mind my own business. You oughta try it some time.
Why?
It's not near as dangerous as the way you're livin' now.
Curly, I got me two rifles right underneath that seating area.
You always keep two rifles under the seat?
Yes, sir. My wife cleans them and loads them for me. Now, a lot of men get fried chicken.
You got a good wife.
Yeah, I know it. She used to ride shotgun for me. Then she said it got, uh, got too hard on her ovaries.

[pauses]
What's an ovary?
Well, near as I can tell, it's uh, you know, part of her machinery.
Oh.
I think I'll go on inside. You want somebody to relieve ya?
No. What I really want is a look in that banker's bag.
He keeps that dang thing closer to him than his belt buckle.
That's why I want a look in it.
[pauses]
The bag.
The sight of blood bother you much?
Only if it's mine, why?
Are you sayin' that you win by dishonest means?
No ma'am. I win by any means.
Are you sayin' that you win by dishonest means?
No ma'am. I win by any means.
If you make it to Lordsburg, you tell'em I'm closin' this station.
I'd say the Apaches closed it for you.
If I deputized an escaped convict I'd be run outa the territory.
It's better'n bein' carried out.
